chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Weiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Pay DNA surcharge.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not have contact with victim in any form or any other victim.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.
